instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 no wifi
threads.message: No wifi detected in system info. Replaced wifi card and cable and still nada. Tried pram and smc resets just to be sure. No noticeable issues in wifi section of board... I feel like this is something stupid.

threads.title: 820-2850 no wifi
threads.message:
Check L3401/3/4.
If all good, post U3401 voltages.

threads.title: 820-2850 no wifi
threads.message:
3.3V pins 1,2,4,5 of u3401. 0 on pin 3.
L3404 had 3.3V on both sides but zero ohms resistance
3403  - 0V all 4 points 3.3 ohms 
3401 -.37V on all 4 points 1.4 ohms

threads.title: 820-2850 no wifi
threads.message:
Any history available?
Connector pins look good?
Check diode mode on all PCIE data lines.
Be sure C3430/31 are good and check diode mode on boths sides of them.

threads.title: 820-2850 no wifi
threads.message:
Let this one sit for a while being it was a cheaper mac and weird issue.
This WAS something stupid. Went back to look over some things and check connectors like you suggested and sure enough, while at first glance all looked good, poking around half of the pins were off the pads on J3401. Not sure if I looked at this board before I got the high powered scope but that thing has certainly paid for itself! It is at least seeing connection in system info, now just have to get it added back in the profile. Reloading OS. Not sure if there was an easier way. When I tried to add the service back in Wifi was not a possible selection. PRAM reset didn't work either.
